page.title: 04MANOR FARM FISHPOND
page.content: The old{Fish Pond}at{Ratlinghope}is opposite the Manor House behind the wall that makes the front of the pound. The pond is 24m long and 10m wide. There is{an island in the middle}which leaves a{moat of water}3m wide down each side and 5m wide at the end.It was built like that{to make it easy to {net}parts of the moat to catch the fish for the people living in the Manor to eat. The sides of the pond and the island are made of stone with soil on top. The moat is still partly filled with soil but it is being cleaned out. We think the pond was dug out of {clay}.We know there is clay in Ratlinghope because there was a {brickworks}at Brow Farm.
